content.detailedDescription: I think i was on my way to the library, 2 miles away.  i was walking with my head down through a nearby vons parking lot.  when i picked up my head i thought at first i saw 3 black crows flying.  then i realized one of those crows was a ufo.  it was entering a field where railroad tracks used to be.  it was traveling to the far left of the field.  it was all black, and about 20 feet long.  it looked like thin panels with semi-circles in the front and back of it.  the center of it had a large dome.  it was rectangular with short curtains of whatever material in the front and back.  it was about 1" thick all around.  i watched the object as it approached a main street.  it traveled at 2 to 3 mph.  when it crossed the main street it continued on through another field.  i soon lost sight of it as it disappeared into some fog or midst.
content.summary: An object that looked like it cannot possibly fly.

content.detailedDescription: Standing on front porch of house, looking south by southwest, appeared flourescent white round disk the size of the moon, stationary, no strobing lights or anything like that...Just solid bright white light.  dimmed down to a bright grey, then went from bright grey to medium grey, at that point, i saw the surface of this thing, it closely resembled the texture of orange peel.  then it dimmed down to a darker grey, to real dark grey, then began moving in a southwest direction.  when i first saw the round disk, i thought it was the moon, til i looked directly east and realized the moon was in that position in the sky.  it was a full moon that night.  then i looked south again, compared the object to the size of the moon, realized the object was larger than the moon.  approximately 300 ft. in diameter, hard to estimate how high up it was.  just before this happened, me and a friend were joking about boarding a space ship if it landed in the front yard, and we would travel to other galaxies.  i guess it was hearing our conversation.  if you need any more info, you can call me.  thanks
content.summary: Round object appeared, fluorescent white disk.

content.detailedDescription:
I am sure i saw this object in 1978.  it was the first ufo i ever saw.  i was coming home from newport beach at around 5:20 pm.  as i was getting on the freeway that was the beginning of the freeway i was in a lot of traffic.  all of a sudden to my right (south) i saw a large cigar shaped object approaching the freeway.  it was completely covered with lava having no windows.  it was about 60 feet long.  it was about 50 feet high.  it traveled across the freeway at about 3 mph.  when it went behind some trees that were in a resavoir i sped up to see it more, but it was gone.

as soon as i got home about 30 minutes later i put on my radio.  the first station i put on said, "ufo raid in orange county." then 12 people were interviewed who saw a disc shaped object at huntington beach (a neighboring beach from newport beach).  the 12 people said they saw the object for about 7 minutes hovering then it disappeared at a high rate of speed.
content.summary: A cigar shaped covered with lava crossed the freeway

content.detailedDescription:
I was playing tennis with my partner (who is a scienctist), and i was facing north when i spotted a very bright light in the sky. i asked my partner if he could identify the object in the sky. he noticed that the object was moving from west to east at a very low speed, but quite high. then all of a sudden the object stop moving and just stood there for a while. then it started to move toward our direction and the lights were getting brigther. my partner ran inside his home and grabbed his binoculars. 

a minute later when he return, we noticed that the object had started to move back to the west for a short while and stop. at that point we were able to see the object with our binoculars and noticed that it looked like a pole standing up with two bight lights around the pole, which one kept changing direction from the top of the pole to the bottom of the pole. all this lasted approximately 30 minutes. the object proceeded to move west and disappeared into the horizon.

several months back we were also playing tennis when i noticed a sphere in the same area in the sky traveling from east to west at a high rate of speed. at that time i was playing tennis with two partners who are phd's and they were not able to identify the object.
content.summary: Lika a pole with two round lights moving around the pole.

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 2330 hrs on thursday, july 10th 2010 my cousin and i were finishing our bbq dinner at our campsite in the mountains of berry creek, ca. we heard a thunder-like sound and a single, bright, red light flew overhead. my cousin and i are both iraq combat veterans and the sound did not sound like any fighter plane or aircraft we were familiar with. the sound was very brief, unlike the sound of an aircraft flying overhead.

the red dot stopped above a mountain ridge and held position, then several yellow lights appeared around the red light and began moving in sequence as if they were spinning. after holding position for a couple of minutes, am identical light formation appeared to the left of it. the first craft held the same position as the second craft performed maneuvers impossible for a conventional aircraft to achieve; the craft was able to move vertically and laterally without the pattern of lights changing. 

unsure of what the objects were but convinced that they were not possibly any aircraft we could identify, both my cousin and i retrieved our rifles from our truck and continued to keep visual contact with the two unknown objects. 

we continued to watch the second craft perform its maneuvers for the next couple minutes while the first one stayed in place with both of them seemingly staying at the same range from us; after around 10-15 minutes, both craft vectored apart laterally and disappeared from our vision as they flew away from us into the distance.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Two campers witness two craft perform unusual acts.

content.detailedDescription: I was visiting employees who were my friends at the marathon restaurant.  they were closing, so i decided to go home.  it was 10:50 pm.  walking home i looked up behind me soon after i entered an open gate, which was a shortcut.  when i look up behind me i saw a small white dot of light probably 6,000 feet high.  within a couple of seconds the dot of white light traveled almost straight down.  when it got to the center of the street about 60 yards from me i realized it was a weird looking airplane.  at first i thought it was going to crash in the middle of the street, but doing a nose dive it pulled up just in time.  it was not going fast enough as i guess why it did not produce a sonic boom.  it went almost straight up disappearing into space.  it made no sound.  when it was nearing the street i saw it clearly having 5 semi-circles on the backs of each of the side big wings.  the wings were angled backward.  its tail wings were not unusual, as the rest of the plane looked like an ordinary plane.  the semi-circles on the wings made the plane resemble or communicate something evil.
content.summary: An airplane with vulcan type wings.

content.detailedDescription:
Neighbor and i were sitting on front porch deck and noticed a slow moving light which first appeared to be an airplane, but after watching for only 5-10 seconds, we realized that there were no flashing lights or sound which usually accompany airplanes.  as we watched, the light, a soft bright yellow point, moved at an angle towards us then turned slowly toward the east. the distance was between 5-15 miles away. i noticed that it was speeding up and said "its speeding up!", by the time i had finished speaking it had sped up and disappeared into the distance. 
it was kinda like star trek enterprise going into warp but without leaving a trail like on tv, it just went.
(i have since replaced the dead batteries that were in my camera.)
content.summary: Slow light moving across sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Around 10pm, i was at a lake bailee recreational park in overpeck,oh, when a nuuber of us seen four lights in the northeast sky, they began to pull slightly and slowly away from each other -- two moving up and out and the other two moving down. then, one after another, they blinked out disappearing, only to blink back and reappear again one at a time in order. 
i later learned that a hot air balloon festival is occurring this weekend, starting the day of my sighting, in middletown, oh, approximately 10 miles away. i don't believe hot air balloons are what i witnessed due to the fact that event was already over.

that said, i'm still not sure what i witnessed, and for all i know, despite having doubts, it very well could have been lights from the balloon festival. i also see im not the only one who witnessed this event in the sky.
content.summary: Four amber lights in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was at work in the upstairs of my home when my friends (around ten or twelve of them), started screaming and hollering for me.  there was a very erie electrical storm, all lightning but no thunder or wind, and when i got outside i saw at least 15-20 spherical orbs flying very low in formation. in the center of each orb there was a brilliant light. very bright lights came from the center of them, with colors like i'd never seen before. they started to 'power down' the lights. then some of them took off into the sky. one landed or at least appeared to. the others seemed to just be following the storm. as the lights were dimming, i could see that they were not exactly spherical but more like misshapen eggs. and they were see-thru. i felt like crying and laughing at the same time!!! i have always believed in the extraterrestrial and to witness this was one of my greatest moments in life. i wish i could've taken a picture with my phone but i'd left it upstairs. won't leave home without it from now on. called the news but they seemed uninterested. the objects would sometimes stop and start, sometimes appearing to be frozen in space.
content.summary: Mass u.F.O sighting above my house.

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were in our driveway, our friends had just left our house. we turned to go back into our house, and noticed a strange fireball in the night sky. the light appeared to be falling into our atmosphere, it left a trail of light behind it, like what you would expect from a metorite or shooting star. the fireball then split into 2 lights and appeared to go into different directions, one of the lights seemed to burn out. then the light that was left got brighter. suddenly 3 more lights appeared, they seemed to move around each other, then made a very deliberate diamond shape. the lights seemed to stay in the sky for approx 10 minutes. i ran into the house and got my camera, but you can't really see anything on my picture. then i tried to record it from my iphone, but you can only see a tiny dot of light. it was really amazing, and we would love to know if there is any explanation.
content.summary: Unexplained fireball in the night sky.

content.detailedDescription: While sitting outside with my girlfriend my attention was drawn to a helicopter that was flying directly towards us at a low altitude and at a high rate of speed from the east. the sky was overcast and the clouds were very thick. no view of blue sky in any direction. as i was viewing the chopper i saw a strange thing just to the left of the chopper and most likely at a higher elevation ( i say this because the chopper pilot did not react to the object) i saw a single red bar in the sky. it was sitting motionless and parallel to the horizon. it was not saucer shaped nor did it have rounded edges but it was definitely there considering i rubbed my eyes to make sure it was not something generated by my own eye. it was there all right and all i could say was "what the hell is that??" my girlfriend could not see it because of the size and duration ,it really was not easy to capture visually. i only saw it when the moving chopper passed by the stationary object that i literally can not identify. as i was trying to direct her vision in the right direction it just blinked out, gone to leave me pondering what i had just seen. i have read many a ufo reports in my life and i have seen just a few strange things but this is one for the books as far as im concerned.
content.summary: I can only describe this object as a red bar.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside of love field, and noticed this bright ball of light that just kept getting closer and brighter. being near an airport, i figured it was some sort of aircraft, but it wasn't moving like one. suddenly, it just disappeared.
content.summary: Bright light sighting.

content.detailedDescription:
North country, new york.  early morning 5th of july, i'm relaxing in my hot tub enjoying the southern view of the night sky when i notice that venus has what appears to be a "twin" nearby.  after about 10 minutes i notice that this twin begins to move in a north-east direction. my first thought was this is a low flying satellite passing over because of its brightness.  however, as it continued to travel ne it got brighter and brighter.  at its brightest it then turned gently due east remaining bright for another 20 seconds and then it just kind of faded away as if it was turning off its one very bright light.  (notice i said light and not lights) 

i estimate the altitude of this flying bright white light at about one hundred thousand (100,000) feet up at a speed of nine hundred (900) mph.

there was absolutely no sound of any kind.  no emissions of any kind.  no sonic boom, no ufo whiny sound, no jet engine, no helicopter wop-wop, no propeller engine sound... just errie silence and wondering wtf i had just observed.

to this day my gut feeling tells me i either witnessed an alien spacecraft of some kind or this was a sign from god telling us that they or he exist.

how can this star-like bright object just float there disguising itself as just another star in the sky for at least 10 minutes then make itself noticeable when it began to move?  that's the question i ask myself... why did it move? was it trying to communicate with us?  i wouldn't have been the least suspicious that venus had this twin nearby unless it moved.  now i'm a believer in something heavenly but what should it be.... ufo or god?
content.summary: 4th of july ufo.

content.detailedDescription:
Went on the outside to take few photos , 5 in total . in the 1st photo there are these 2 objects & another 2 at much lower altitude & a bit smaller than these so i zoomed on higher ones . in that photo there's also of what appears a dark square but i don't know how to zoom it in on it to show of what this might be , all these seemed to be far away .
i just thought mufon would like to have a look at the attached close up anyway .

i've put an approximate time as since the time of sending in my report a wk. ago of a ufo & a projection by the tree , my camera's internal time clock has been messed up by 2 hrs & don't know of how many minutes . as for my hand watch it took over 24 hrs to get back 
to it's original .
content.summary: 2 dark round circles closely together in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Light #1:(appears every night - if it is raining or cloudy i can't see it)
around 9pm -- out back in the sky is a light that seems to me like it is trying to blend in with the stars. it is way brighter than a star. it is lower than the stars too. it moves from behind our home to farther away where you can't see it anymore. when it moves it goes very slow, like it is trying to be undetected. it moves back and forth as it is moving forward. by 10:30pm you can't see it anymore.

light #2: (appears every night- if it is raining or cloudy i can't see it)
around 11pm - 12pm (haven't pinned down the time yet) but the second light starts off in a distance, you can just see it over the houses. it comes from the direction of westminster. as it is moving toward our direction it moves slowly and shifts back and forth like the other light. it gets brighter as it gets closer. i have not watched this one till it disapears.

other lights: 
a few days ago i noticed something stranger. i was standing out on my front porch and there was a bright light in the sky above me. as i looked up it dimmed. it was up with the stars.  it was moving across the sky very quickly, i lost site of it as it went over the house. 

(this was not a plane!!!- the lights i am talking about are not planes!!!)

i kept watching the sky that night and i saw another one ahead of me, again up in the stars, it looked like a star moving. as it passed some stars, those stars got brighter and dimmed again. then it disappeared.

then i saw another one moving to the left, again it looked like a star and was high up with the stars.

i went out back to see if i could see them better look, i saw yet another one and it was headed right for a star within a cluster of stars, but then that star shifted to the left to let it go by and after it passed the star went back in place. 

then another one in the cluster started going in the opposite direction.

i saw more out front that night - i saw a total of 10 of these things.

they were there for maybe a minute each time i saw them, they were moving fast, and they weren't moving exactly straight, they moved back and forth a little as they moved. these lights were alot higher than the first 2 i listed above.

i have taken pics of the first 2 lights i described, but my camera doesn't have a good zoom so it just looks like i took pics of the night sky. i have also looked at them thru a telescope and can't get focused on them cause its just a cheap telescope that doesn't zoom in on things.

if someone needs to contact me to further investigate this, that is fine. i do not want to be on the news etc. thank you.


answers to your questions on the left:
1. i was home and i went outside to smoke a cigarette and/or walk my dog.
2. i noticed the #1 & #2 light because it was so bright, i watched them (at different times) and realized they was moving. the other lights - the first one i noticed caught my attention because it was bright and moving and up with the stars.
3. the first thought that came into my mind when i saw the other lights, is that they were ufo's, when i saw the lights #1 i thought they were ufo's or possibly some hush hush military stuff.
4. #1 & #2 are bright lights low in the sky, they shift back and forth as they move slowly across the sky. the other lights are dim like the stars and are extremely high up and do blend in with the stars, they move fast and slightly back and forth.
5. i watched them, then i would tell someone to come out and look to, to make sure they were seeing what i was seeing. it creeped me out but i am curious at the same time. i watch the skies every night.
6. #1 i loose sight of it when it moves far off, can't see it passed the houses. #2 i haven't lost sight of it, it is out there when i go to bed. the other lights move quick and dim out and i can't see them any more, go over the house out of my sight or they just dissapear.
3.
content.summary: Lights in ky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was working at a local wal-mart as a shopping cart attendant, in colorado springs, co.
i was outside, awaiting my relief so that i could go home.
it is imperative here to mention that the date was shortly after 9-11, and most air traffic was grounded, and this town is a big military town, so they extended their grounding a few days, and the day of this sighting was during their no-fly period.
so i can absolutely be sure this was not a commercial plane, but i am not ruling out the possibility of secret military craft.
as i was waiting for my relief, i glanced at the mountain range, and when i did, i noticed a small silver ball come gliding over the store, make an arc in front of the mountain range, and stop to the north of the store.
as i was watching the silver ball, another red one showed up from the direction of denver.
it stopped parrallel to the silver one, and they both faded in and out for a few minutes.
they than began to switch positions, and i don't mean by moving.
i mean they would fade completely out, and than re-appear, but in each others position.
in other words, the red one would be were the silver one was, and the silver one would be were the red one was.
this continued for a few minutes, and than they faded completely out of sight.
content.summary: A small silver ball came over the store i was working at, and stopped over in front of the mountain range, another red one came from the direction of denver and stopped on the other side of the silver one.  they both began to fade in and out

content.detailedDescription:
I live in north dallas. i was in my back yard taking the new puppy for a potty break. out of my peripheral vision i noticed a really bright star. i wondered for a split second if it was the north star, but had never seen any star (planet or comet) so bright/big before. and then realized it was off toward the west.  i wondered if it was a planet, but it seemed to big. 

i was lined up with the waterfall in our backyard and it was directly in the middle of three branches surrounding it. i watched it for ten minutes and it didn't move; it didn't deviate one bit. i thought maybe it's a plane from a very, very far distance away moving toward me. but at the same time it didn't move, and even if the object was moving toward me it should be getting slightly bigger or smaller if moving away. 

at that point i heard my puppy and turned to see her doing #1 in the grass, when i turned back the object had dropped over a foot lower and about the same distance to the right/north. i'm not sure the exact mathematics on it, how big this was or how far away it was. but due to the distance it looked to be, i can't think of any plane that could or would hover motionless for ten minutes and then move in the amount of time it did and stay motionless again. the whole time i couldn't make out a shape. i just thought it looked like the brightest star i had ever seen by far, without comparison. at least 100x brighter. it was a radiating light. it wasn't yellow, or white, and there were no blinking lights around it. it seemed to have a tinge of green. you know when they o a whitening gum commercial and the tooth sparkles, that's what it did. it wasn't glowing, bright rays of light glinted off of it. i looked up stars and planets in the night sky and we're not supposed to have anything visible to the naked eye until august.

i went inside to make sure everything was closed and locked, after that i made sure my son was asleep. it was five minutes at most. i went back out and it was gone, nowhere visible in the sky surrounding our backyard. 

i don't know what this was, maybe there is an explanation i haven't thought of. i just can't imagine what that might be. if anyone saw the same thing or has an answer i'm all ears.
content.summary: Non moving for the most part - 1 big/quick movement.

content.detailedDescription: I was looking at the moon while seated on my backyard deck when a bright object to the west of the moon appeared out of nowhere and appeared to stay stationary for a few seconds then move eatsward and stop one more time briefly.  i yelled for my adult son and daughter to come out and see this event. the object then started to move very slowly eatward and my son and daughter came out onto the deck at that time to witness it moving eastward. the object almost appeared to be rotating but was so high in the atmosphere we could not tell if rotating or flipping back and forth.  from our perspective it seems this object was huge and possibly in space even though it was light out. we all observed the object move very slowly for a matter of minutes and then disappear.  we know the characteristics of satellites and aircraft and this was neither. i observed it appear out of nowhere and stop twice and we all observed how slow it moved. it appeared to me to be in the shape of a flat panel. distance and heighth was to great to be accurate on shape. it wa very bright and that wasn't due to reflection of the sun to the west.
content.summary: Blinking or flipping motion bright against sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was walking down yorktown east of beach blvd when i looked up and noticed an orb or sphere shaped object at about 25 thousand feet and about 2 miles off the coast traveling at maybe 300 mph when it stoped in mid flight then continued on then you could tell it went into a deep exceleration stright up out of sight.I know aircraft as many fly in pateren on approach and take off from both orange county airport and long beach airport. this was not a fixed winged aircraft for sure.
content.summary: White sphere against a clear blue morning sky.

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were driving home on maud hughes road at approximately 9:45 p.M. heading north.  we saw a large fireball in the sky.  we thought maybe it was a meteor, but it was continuing to burn strong and bright.  the fireball then split into two large fireballs. after dropping a little, another split until there were four but dropping slowed and now they were floating and hanging, "winked" out, but lit back on again.  (the fire)  til they appeared to either land or burn out.  because of trees and unable to see further, we were not sure where they were, could not see any fire or bright lights in the distance as though anything had landed.  it was a falling ball of fire that slowed and later hung and floated, controlled equally each of the fireballs.  all were uniform.  

i was very excited.  i thought maybe it was something from the dayton airshow.  my husband, agreed.  i also considered, as did my husband, at first a plane crashing to the ground.  it entered my mind that we were being bombed, never heard any explosions, and the fireballs stopped falling.  we were anxious to get home and watch the news, look on the internet, but saw nothing.  i believe there will be some explanation and i am very curious.
content.summary: Large fireball falling in the sky, like meteor, but not burning out, however, splitting.

content.detailedDescription:
In the morning i observed a contrail of approx 20 degree in length in an easterly direction in prince william county just west of quantico.
the beginning and the end of the contrail was very clear, and had a clean central trail with perfect "popcorn" or donut necklace chains attached. i listened and could not pick up any taletale sounds . however i could also not pick up any regular airplane noise from any other jets at lower or same altitude. in all my sky wathing, and sightings of contrails i have never seen such.
i chanced the sighting while talking to a man on his porch at a higher angle, and was able to see it over his shoulder. it was morning, and the sky was clear except for other contrails.
it took about 15 minutes for it to disperse.
content.summary: Contrail, popcorn on a string, 20 degree ark. easterly very high altitude.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were in our driveway.  she saw the incident too.  i saw a fireball fall from the clouds (it was overcast).  ar first i thought it was a meteor.  then the fireball split into four then disappeared.  a few seconds later, all 4 reappeared above the plane where they had vanished.  they hovered for a few minutes moving back and forth from left to right and back again.  they appeared to be about 5 miles away but no more than ten.  they glowed yellow like a flame the whole time then disappeared behind the clouds again.  i've never seen a plane act this way and never seen one glow like a fire.
content.summary: Fireball like burning satellite. split to 4. disappeared. reappeared as hovering lights.

content.detailedDescription:
It's about 105 degrees or more so i was swimming in my pool around 7pm when i looked up at the sky and saw what i thought was a white balloon at first. i thought that because it is very bright with the sun still way up above the horizon and there was this bright white light going across the sky from south to north in my full view. since i just reported a sighting of a bright light last month, june 27th, one in the morning 1am and the second that same day around 9:35pm.

this bright object moved steadily across the sky and it appeared very close to me. it did not waver around like a balloon would so my mind began to accept it that it was not.

as i was watching it going north i told myself that if it kept going i would attribute it as some sort of silent brightly lit satellite or plane or something. but what it did next is what convinced me it was not a balloon or any other earthly thing.

first it was silent with no red lights flashing or any lights flashing. i noticed also that the craft wasn't going so much north as it was going higher into the sky. so it appeared to slow down but was still moving. it went higher into the sky and appeared like a star with the sum reflecting on it except that the bright light surrounded the celestial as opposed to having one side brighter than the other.

it continued higher and higher and i could still see it until it just looked like a disappearing star in the sky. it never finished it's direction north but went away, appearing like it was but really just going higher until it disappeared. it definitely was not a balloon because there was no wind to speak of and only a gentle breeze once in a while.

i know something is happening because i can feel it, i've had more visions of it lately and i have a sense of expectations of seeing them and experiencing them even more. i also have the sense that they are going to take me away, which i welcome actually.

well, that's all. a bright starlight in a very well lit sky because it was early evening with the sum up, shining and hotter than hell! peace and love
content.summary: A bright light crosses redding sky

content.detailedDescription: I went outside to take the trash out and looked towards the west and noticed a red glowing ball of light that looked like a booster falling from the sky about 30,000 feet up then it just disapeared as if someone turned out the light.  it was brighter then a star.  it was so bright you could spot it easily and was worth reporting on this website because someone told me if you see a ufo report it especially the time because ufos travel.
content.summary: Red glowing object

content.detailedDescription: See these frequently over sangre de cristo mountain range on the east side of the san juan valley.  not going into detail, not much more to say.
content.summary: Brighter than the sun, half the size of the moon, 90 degree turn, faded in and then out.  went 2 seconds horizontal and zoomed up vertical to dissappear.

content.detailedDescription:
When i went to bed at night to sleep in about 20 seconds i rolled over.  as i was rolling over i saw outside my window a very beautiful object traveling eastward at about 1 mph.  it was just above the carports.  it looked like an outline of a concoction of boxes.  like boxes that were piled up where you can only see the outline of them.  each corner had a different colored xmas tree type light.  the lights blinked randomly.  the center of the object looked like bubble glass where there was white light inside.  in the center of the glass was a perfect cross.  i could not determine the material of the cross.  other than the lighted glass the face of it could not be seen.  the object seemed to have arguing going on inside.  just something i sensed, and not heard.  i lost sight of the object when it went out of my view behind my window.

this sighting happened so many years ago.  i do not even remember the year.  i believe i was accurate in describing it.
content.summary: Beautiful concoction just outside my bedroom window.

content.detailedDescription:
On the morning of the 18th of july at approx. 1:47am, i was in my living room and decided to go outside for a cigarette. it was later than i usually go to bed as my 15 week old daughter was having trouble getting to sleep. as i lit the cigarette i noticed 2 orange lights in the distance far away from the rooftops. today was the first day of a bi-yearly festival so i thought it was a couple of fireworks going off. i thought i'd keep my eye on them as the fireworks should of finished at 11pm and it looks like people were still letting them off.

the first thing that struck me was the silence, i live close to where the festival is taking place and the fireworks earlier in the night where like artillery going off in my back garden. these lights were silent and after several seconds they were still in the air and not making the usual whistles or exploding. quite unusual, i dismissed them as fireworks but they were moving closer so i thought they were airplanes as there's an airport in the next town from us.

as i kept watching i noticed they were not airplanes either. they were moving far too fast and were far too bright. when airplanes pass over they are very slow and usually 2 or 3 red blinking lights and a constant white one. the 2 objects where moving very fast and where bright orange. it's hard to estimate a speed, but comparing it to airplanes passing overheard at say 600mph after flying for 20-30 minutes, these objects where flying about 3000-4000mph. they covered the night sky in about 30 seconds. they couldnt of been fireworks as the festival is about 1.5-2 miles away and even though i could see and here the fireworks vividly, i've never known fireworks to travel that high up and that distance before now.

both objects where flying fast and high, one of them sped up as to catch up with the other. after seeing them fly flawlessly straight for two minutes, the one catching up seemed to turn and then both of them sped up faster and disapeared within the blink of an eye.

my first thoughts were curiosity over what i thought they might be, then intrigue of finding out they aren't what i thought. when i realised what they weren't i started to think about what they could be. it didn't even occur to me that they could be anything unidentifiable until they got about halfway across the sky, i felt excitement over witnessing it but somehow i over-rided my awe and ran inside to get the camera. i'm still feeling a little excited even now.

it was a pitch black night with only a few clouds in the sky, it had rained a little earlier in the day but cleared up in the afternoon. the only way i can describe them where two very bright orange lights, i couldn't see what shape or size they where. but compared to air traffic, they seemed like they were not as high up, but where moving extremely fast. i watched them for approx. 2 mins before i ran inside and picked up my digital camera which took about 20 seconds maximum. they were still there when i returned outside and managed to take 3 photos, i witnessed them for a few more seconds before one of them increased speed and changed direction slightly. then both of them increased speed and disapeared. they didn't disappear over rooftops, they just seemed to of gone up.

i only managed to get one clear shot of the two orange lights. the 2nd seems to show an outline. the 3rd didn't seem to capture anything but i've included it anyway.
content.summary: Two orange lights.

content.detailedDescription:
At 9:42 p.M., i turned onto oh-744e/somerville jacksonburg rd from state rd., heading east towards jacksonburg. shortly after making the turn i noticed four objects in the sky. the easiest way to describe them is that they looked like amber-colored streetlights. they appeared only as lights -- i could not see any shape or object around or near them. i'm not an expert on judging distance, but, to me, it seemed like they were somewhat above the area where highway 503 cuts through 744 (about three or four miles east of me).

when i first saw them they appeared in a nonuniform cluster. they began to pull slightly and slowly away from each other -- two moving up and out and the other two moving down. then, one after another, they blinked out disappearing, only to blink back and reappear again one at a time in order.

as i continued driving towards them, i lost sight of them due to a curve in the road and stands of trees and buildings blocking my line of sight. when i spotted them again, they were in an entirely different formation, a descending line from north to south, something like:
o

   o
 
      o
   
         o

they again, in order and one at a time, blinked out and reappeared.

at this time, i also noticed what appeared to be an airplane or helicopter to the north of the lights. it stayed roughly in the same area just away from them to the north for the next few minutes as i observed them while still driving towards where i assumed the lights were above.

due to the road, i lost sight of the lights again. i finally came to the clearing where the highway intersected with highway 503, but they were nowhere to be seen. i stopped my car and waited a moment, but they never returned. i did notice what i'm only assuming is the same plane or helicopter i'd noticed earlier (i think it was a plane since i couldn't hear it) heading rather rapidly south towards cincinnati.

the sighting, although with moments where i could not see the lights, took about 8 minutes. this is probably about double of the average time to travel this distance, but i had phoned a friend to tell him about what i was seeing, and being on the phone and mostly watching the sky instead of the road, i was driving a fair bit slower than normal.
----

i later learned that a hot air balloon festival is occurring this weekend, starting the day of my sighting, in middletown, oh, approximately 15 miles away. i don't believe hot air balloons are what i witnessed however, for a number of reasons:

1. i looked up the schedule for the festival in middletown. there was a "balloon glow" event scheduled that night, but it went from 9:00-9:30, and would have ended roughly 15 minutes before i noticed anyway. there was a pyrotechnics event from 9:30 to 10:00, but the object i saw were definitely not fireworks.

2. the sky wasn't that dark yet, and i believe i would have seen the shapes of the balloons themselves if that's what the objects were.

3. the lights themselves simply did not appear like the flames of hot air balloons. they were consistent and did not flicker, and when the objects blinked back and forth it was an instant switch -- the lights did not once alter shape or brightness. the size of the lights as well seem like they were far too large to be a balloon 15 miles away.

that said, i'm still not sure what i witnessed, and for all i know, despite having doubts, it very well could have been lights from the balloon festival.
content.summary: Four amber lights in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: I just stepped outside onto my porch for some air & to gaze into the stars. i started glancing around though the sky and to the south west of my porch, i noticed a red glowing object. it was not a plane or helicopter because there were no flashing lights or movement. the object was steadily hovering. as i continued to view the object, i quickly noticed it was much brighter and larger than a star would appear. about a minute into viewing the red glowing object, i noticed 2 small blue balls of light which came from below the glowing object. 1 of the balls of light quickly dropped down and i could not see where exactly because of a neighbor's trees. the 2 ball of light remained beside the red glowing object. about 30 seconds later, the second ball dropped quickly downward. and again, i could not see where it went being blocked by the neighbor's trees. not much longer after that, the red glowing object quickly flew downward. as if it was trying to hide after being spotted. the downward movement was not a free fall by all means, it was a very quick downward decent. i lost visual of the red glowing object after it feel below my site of view under the neighbor's trees. i quickly ran inside to grab my camera in hopes i could catch it lifting off from where ever it may of landed. i stayed out side for another 45 minutes but never saw the object again. i was in complete shock seeing it from the first moment to the last moment. even while continuing to wait for it's reappearance, i knew exactly what i witnessed. this was not a comet, plane, helicopter or even a flare. i've witnessed them all during day & night, what this was could not be compared to what i witnessed. i almost got the sense it knew it was being watched. when the thought of grabbing my camera came across my mind, that's when the object started its quick decline.
content.summary: Red glowing object, brighter than a star.

content.detailedDescription: Couple od kids driving in car, age 14-18, at night in village ravne nort from pljevlja, montenegro, where is  road in nowhere. seen red glow sphere, description "looks like sun, but it can't be", emiting red rays all over. panicked and run away in car. tommorow they coudn't hold theyr cell phones in hands from fear.
content.summary: Looks like red sun, radiating red rays.
